trans-unit.source: The second form of annotation in text widgets is a mark. Marks are used for remembering particular places in a text. They are something like tags, in that they have names and they refer to places in the file, but a mark is not associated with particular characters. Instead, a mark is associated with the gap between two characters. Only a single position may be associated with a mark at any given time. If the characters around a mark are deleted the mark will still remain; it will just have new neighbor characters. In contrast, if the characters containing a tag are deleted then the tag will no longer have an association with characters in the file. Marks may be manipulated with the “
trans-unit.target: 文本小部件中注释的第二种形式是标记。标记用于记住文本中的特定位置。它们就像标签一样，它们具有名称，它们引用文件中的位置，但是标记与特定字符没有关联。而是将标记与两个字符之间的间距关联。在任何给定时间，只有一个位置可以与标记关联。如果删除标记周围的字符，标记仍将保留；它只会有新的邻居字符。相反，如果删除包含标签的字符，则标签将不再与文件中的字符相关联。可以使用“

trans-unit.source: The second purpose for tags is event bindings. trans-unit.source: The sections below describe the various types of items supported by canvas widgets. Each item type is characterized by two things: first, the form of the create command used to create instances of the type; and second, a set of configuration options for items of that type, which may be used in the create and itemconfigure widget commands. Most items do not support indexing or selection or the commands related to them, such as index and insert. Where items do support these facilities, it is noted explicitly in the descriptions below. At present, text, line and polygon items provide this support. For lines and polygons the indexing facility is used to manipulate the coordinates of the item.
trans-unit.target: 以下各节描述了画布小部件支持的各种类型的项目。每种项目类型都有两个特征：首先，用于创建该类型实例的create命令的形式；第二，该类型项目的一组配置选项，可在create和itemconfigure小部件命令中使用。大多数项目不支持索引或选择或与之相关的命令，例如index和insert。如果项目确实支持这些功能，则在以下描述中明确指出。目前，文本，线和面项目提供了这种支持。对于线和面，索引工具用于操纵项目的坐标。

trans-unit.source: The size modifier field is used only when scanning a substring into one of Tcl's integer values. The size modifier field dictates the integer range acceptable to be stored in a variable, or, for the inline case, in a position in the result list. The syntactically valid values for the size modifier are h, L, l, and ll. The h size modifier value is equivalent to the absence of a size modifier in the the conversion specifier. Either one indicates the integer range to be stored is limited to the same range produced by the int() function of the expr command. The L size modifier is equivalent to the l size modifier. Either one indicates the integer range to be stored is limited to the same range produced by the wide() function of the expr command. The ll size modifier indicates that the integer range to be stored is unlimited.
trans-unit.target: 仅当将子字符串扫描到Tcl的整数值之一时，才使用大小修饰符字段。大小修饰符字段指示可接受的整数范围，该整数范围可以存储在变量中，对于内联情况，可以存储在结果列表中的某个位置。大小修饰符的语法有效值为h，L，l和ll。的ħ大小修正值是等效于没有在所述转换指定的尺寸改性剂。任一表示要存储的整数范围限于expr命令的int（）函数产生的相同范围。的大号尺寸改性剂是等同于升大小修改器。任一表示要存储的整数范围被限制为由expr命令的wide（）函数产生的相同范围。的LL尺寸修饰符指示待存储的整数范围是无限的。

trans-unit.source: The stack will be unwound until the error is trapped by a suitable catch or try command. If it reaches the event loop without being trapped, it will be reported through the bgerror mechanism. trans-unit.target: 堆栈将被展开，直到错误被适当的catch或try命令捕获为止。如果到达事件循环而没有被捕获，它将通过bgerror机制进行报告。如果它达到tclsh中脚本评估​​的最高级别，它将在非交互情况下导致退出之前在控制台上打印（其他程序的行为将取决于Tcl的嵌入和使用方式的细节）。 。

trans-unit.source: The third portion of a conversion specifier is a decimal number giving a minimum field width for this conversion. It is typically used to make columns line up in tabular printouts. If the converted argument contains fewer characters than the minimum field width then it will be padded so that it is as wide as the minimum field width. Padding normally occurs by adding extra spaces on the left of the converted argument, but the 0 and - flags may be used to specify padding with zeroes on the left or with spaces on the right, respectively. If the minimum field width is specified as * rather than a number, then the next argument to the format command determines the minimum field width; it must be an integer value.
trans-unit.target: 转换说明符的第三部分是一个十进制数字，给出了此转换的最小字段宽度。它通常用于使列在表格打印输出中对齐。如果转换后的参数包含的字符少于最小字段宽度，则将对其进行填充，使其与最小字段宽度一样宽。填充通常是通过在转换后的参数的左侧添加多余的空格来进行的，但是0和-标志可用于指定填充，左侧分别为零或右侧为空格。如果最小字段宽度指定为*而不是数字，那么format命令的下一个参数将确定最小字段宽度；它必须是整数值。

trans-unit.source: The third use for tags is in managing the selection. See THE SELECTION below. trans-unit.source: The thread created in the above example will never be able to exit . After it has been released with the last matching thread::release call, the thread will jump out of the thread::wait and continue to execute commands following . trans-unit.source: The two-argument form is a “half-close”: given a bidirectional channel like a socket or command pipeline and a (possibly abbreviated) direction, it closes only the sub-stream going in that direction. This means a shutdown() on a socket, and a close() of one end of a pipe for a command pipeline. Then, the Tcl-level channel data structure is either kept or freed depending on whether the other direction is still open.

The value is a two-element list for read-write channels; the read translation mode is the first element of the list, and the write translation mode is the second element. As a convenience, when setting the translation mode for a read-write channel you can specify a single value that will apply to both reading and writing. When querying the translation mode of a read-write channel, a two-element list will always be returned. The following values are currently supported:

trans-unit.source: The value must be a boolean. If true, it means that this window will be used as a container in which some other application will be embedded (for example, a Tk toplevel can be embedded using the -use option). The window will support the appropriate window manager protocols for things like geometry requests. The window should not have any children of its own in this application. This option may not be changed with the configure widget command.

trans-unit.source: The value must be a boolean. trans-unit.source: The value of this variable can be set to control how much tracing information is displayed during bytecode compilation. By default, tcl_traceCompile is zero and no information is displayed. Setting tcl_traceCompile to 1 generates a one-line summary in stdout whenever a procedure or top-level command is compiled. Setting it to 2 generates a detailed listing in stdout of the bytecode instructions emitted during every compilation. This variable is useful in tracking down suspected problems with the Tcl compiler.
trans-unit.target: 可以设置此变量的值，以控制在字节码编译期间显示多少跟踪信息。默认情况下，tcl_traceCompile为零，并且不显示任何信息。每当编译过程或顶层命令时，将tcl_traceCompile设置为1 都会在stdout中生成单行摘要。将其设置为2会在标准输出中生成每次编译期间发出的字节码指令的详细列表。此变量在跟踪Tcl编译器中的可疑问题时很有用。

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable can be set to control how much tracing information is displayed during bytecode execution. By default, tcl_traceExec is zero and no information is displayed. Setting tcl_traceExec to 1 generates a one-line trace in stdout on each call to a Tcl procedure. Setting it to 2 generates a line of output whenever any Tcl command is invoked that contains the name of the command and its arguments. Setting it to 3 produces a detailed trace showing the result of executing each bytecode instruction. Note that when tcl_traceExec is 2 or 3, commands such as set and incr that have been entirely replaced by a sequence of bytecode instructions are not shown. Setting this variable is useful in tracking down suspected problems with the bytecode compiler and interpreter.
trans-unit.target: 可以设置此变量的值，以控制在字节码执行期间显示多少跟踪信息。默认情况下，tcl_traceExec为零，并且不显示任何信息。将tcl_traceExec设置为1会在每次调用Tcl过程时在stdout中生成单行跟踪。每当调用任何包含命令名称及其参数的Tcl命令时，将其设置为2都会生成一行输出。将其设置为3会产生详细的跟踪，显示执行每个字节码指令的结果。请注意，当tcl_traceExec为2或3时，诸如set和incr的命令未显示已完全由一系列字节码指令代替的指令。设置此变量对于跟踪字节码编译器和解释器的可疑问题很有用。

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is a regular expression that can be set to control what are considered “non-word” characters, for instances like selecting a word by double-clicking in text in Tk. It is platform dependent. On Windows, it defaults to \s, meaning any Unicode space character. Otherwise it defaults to \W, which is anything but a Unicode word character (number, letter, or underscore).
trans-unit.target: 该变量的值是一个正则表达式，可以设置为控制所谓的“非单词”字符，例如，通过双击Tk中的文本来选择单词。它取决于平台。在Windows上，它默认为\ s，表示任何Unicode空格字符。否则，它默认为\ W，它不是Unicode字字符（数字，字母或下划线）。

trans-unit.source: The value of this variable is a regular expression that can be set to control what are considered “word” characters, for instances like selecting a word by double-clicking in text in Tk. It is platform dependent. On Windows, it defaults to \S, meaning anything but a Unicode space character. Otherwise it defaults to \w, which is any Unicode word character (number, letter, or underscore).
trans-unit.target: 该变量的值是一个正则表达式，可以将其设置为控制哪些字符被视为“单词”字符，例如，通过双击Tk中的文本来选择单词。它取决于平台。在Windows上，它默认为\ S，表示除Unicode空格字符外的任何字符。否则，默认为\ w，它是任何Unicode单词字符（数字，字母或下划线）。

trans-unit.source: There are a few remaining points about qualified names that we should cover. Namespaces have nonempty names except for the global namespace. :: is disallowed in simple command, variable, and namespace names except as a namespace separator. Extra colons in any separator part of a qualified name are ignored; i.e. two or more colons are treated as a namespace separator. A trailing :: in a qualified variable or command name refers to the variable or command named {}. However, a trailing :: in a qualified namespace name is ignored.
trans-unit.target: 关于合格名称，我们还有一些要注意的地方。命名空间具有非空名称，但全局命名空间除外。::除了简单的名称空间分隔符外，在简单的命令，变量和名称空间名称中均不允许使用::。限定名称的分隔符部分中的多余冒号将被忽略；即两个或多个冒号被视为名称空间分隔符。限定变量或命令名称中的结尾::表示名为{}的变量或命令。但是，限定名称空间名称中的尾部::将被忽略。

trans-unit.source: There are many times in applications where you want to temporarily restrict what actions the user can take. For example, an application could have a “Run” button that when pressed causes some processing to occur. However, while the application is busy processing, you probably don't want the user to be able to click the “Run” button again. You may also want restrict the user from other tasks such as clicking a “Print” button.

trans-unit.source: There is an inherent historical ambiguity between octal character-entry escapes and back references, which is resolved by heuristics, as hinted at above. A leading zero always indicates an octal escape. A single non-zero digit, not followed by another digit, is always taken as a back reference. A multi-digit sequence not starting with a zero is taken as a back reference if it comes after a suitable subexpression (i.e. the number is in the legal range for a back reference), and otherwise is taken as octal.
trans-unit.target: 在八进制字符输入转义和回溯引用之间存在固有的历史模糊性,如上文所提示的,通过启发式方法解决。前导零总是表示八进制转义。单个非零的数字,如果后面没有另一个数字,则总是作为后参考。如果一个非零开头的多位数序列出现在一个合适的子表达式之后(即数字在合法的范围内,可以作为后参考),则将其作为后参考,否则将作为八进制。

trans-unit.source: There is one special case to permit procedures with variable numbers of arguments. trans-unit.source: These two events are sent to every sub-window of a toplevel when they change state. In addition to the focus Window, the Macintosh platform and Windows platforms have a notion of an active window (which often has but is not required to have the focus). On the Macintosh, widgets in the active window have a different appearance than widgets in deactive windows. The Activate event is sent to all the sub-windows in a toplevel when it changes from being deactive to active. Likewise, the Deactive event is sent when the window's state changes from active to deactive. There are no useful percent substitutions you would make when binding to these events.
trans-unit.target: 当它们更改状态时，这两个事件将发送到顶层的每个子窗口。除了焦点窗口外，Macintosh平台和Windows平台还具有活动窗口的概念（通常具有但不需要具有焦点）。在Macintosh上，活动窗口中的小部件的外观与非活动窗口中的小部件的外观不同。当激活事件从非活动状态变为活动状态时，会将其发送到顶层的所有子窗口。同样，当窗口的状态从活动变为活动时，发送Deactive事件。绑定到这些事件时，没有有用的百分比替换。

trans-unit.source: This approach has three advantages over the approach in the previous paragraph. First, the location of the tclsh binary does not have to be hard-wired into the script: it can be anywhere in your shell search path. Second, it gets around the 30-character file name limit in the previous approach. Third, this approach will work even if tclsh is itself a shell script (this is done on some systems in order to handle multiple architectures or operating systems: the tclsh script selects one of several binaries to run). The three lines cause both sh and tclsh to process the script, but the exec is only executed by sh. sh processes the script first; it treats the second line as a comment and executes the third line. The exec statement cause the shell to stop processing and instead to start up tclsh to reprocess the entire script. When tclsh starts up, it treats all three lines as comments, since the backslash at the end of the second line causes the third line to be treated as part of the comment on the second line.
trans-unit.target: 与上一段中的方法相比，此方法具有三个优点。首先，tclsh二进制文件的位置不必硬连接到脚本中：它可以在shell搜索路径中的任何位置。其次，它绕过了前一种方法中文件名最多30个字符的限制。第三，即使tclsh本身是一个shell脚本，该方法也将起作用（在某些系统上完成该操作是为了处理多个体系结构或操作系统：tclsh脚本选择要运行的几个二进制文件之一）。这三行使sh和tclsh都处理脚本，但是exec仅由sh执行。SH首先处理脚本；它将第二行视为注释并执行第三行。在EXEC语句导致shell停止处理而启动tclsh的重新处理整个脚本。当tclsh的启动时，它把所有三行都作为注释，因为在第二行的反斜线导致第三行被作为第二行注释的一部分对待。

trans-unit.source: This approach has three advantages over the approach in the previous paragraph. First, the location of the wish binary does not have to be hard-wired into the script: it can be anywhere in your shell search path. Second, it gets around the 30-character file name limit in the previous approach. Third, this approach will work even if wish is itself a shell script (this is done on some systems in order to handle multiple architectures or operating systems: the wish script selects one of several binaries to run). The three lines cause both sh and wish to process the script, but the exec is only executed by sh. sh processes the script first; it treats the second line as a comment and executes the third line. The exec statement cause the shell to stop processing and instead to start up wish to reprocess the entire script. When wish starts up, it treats all three lines as comments, since the backslash at the end of the second line causes the third line to be treated as part of the comment on the second line.
trans-unit.target: 与上一段中的方法相比，此方法具有三个优点。首先，wish二进制文件的位置不必硬连接到脚本中：它可以在外壳程序搜索路径中的任何位置。其次，它绕过了前一种方法中文件名最多30个字符的限制。第三，即使wish本身就是一个shell脚本，该方法也将起作用（在某些系统上完成该操作是为了处理多个体系结构或操作系统：wish脚本从多个二进制文件中选择一个来运行）。这三行同时导致sh和希望处理该脚本，但是exec仅由sh执行。SH首先处理脚本；它将第二行视为注释并执行第三行。在EXEC语句导致shell停止处理而启动的愿望来重新处理整个脚本。当愿望开始时，它将所有三行都视为注释，因为第二行末尾的反斜杠导致第三行被视为第二行注释的一部分。

trans-unit.target: 此命令将转换应用于字典的每个元素，并返回新的字典。它包含三个参数：第一个是变量名称的两元素列表（分别用于字典中每个映射的键和值），第二个是要迭代的字典值，第三个是每个变量要评估的脚本使用适当设置的键和值变量进行映射（以lmap的方式）。在评估脚本正常完成的迭代（TCL_OK，而不是错误等）中，使用作为当前内容的键将脚本的结果放入累加器字典中。

trans-unit.source: This command concatenates given arguments and evaluates the resulting Tcl command with trace framework enabled . If the command execution was ok, it takes necessary steps to automatically propagate the trace epoch change to all threads in the application . For AOLserver, only newly created threads actually receive the epoch change . For the Tcl threading extension, all threads created by the extension are automatically updated . If the command execution resulted in Tcl error, no state propagation takes place .
trans-unit.target: 该命令连接给定的参数,并在启用trace框架的情况下评估产生的Tcl命令。如果命令执行正常,它将采取必要的步骤,自动将trace epoch变化传播给应用程序中的所有线程,对于AOLserver,只有新创建的线程才会真正收到epoch变化。对于AOLserver来说,只有新创建的线程才会真正收到epoch变化。对于Tcl线程扩展,所有由该扩展创建的线程都会自动更新 。如果命令的执行导致Tcl错误,则不会发生状态传播。

trans-unit.source: This command concatenates passed arguments and evaluates the resulting script under the internal mutex protection . During the script evaluation, the entire shared variable is locked . For shared variable commands within the script, internal locking is disabled so no deadlock can occur . It is also allowed to unset the shared variable from within the script . The shared variable is automatically created if it did not exists at the time of the first lock operation .
trans-unit.target: 该命令将传递的参数连接起来,并在内部mutex保护下评估产生的脚本。在脚本评估期间,整个共享变量被锁定。对于脚本中的共享变量命令,内部锁定是被禁用的,因此不会发生死锁。它也允许在脚本内部取消设置共享变量。如果共享变量在第一次锁定操作时不存在,则会自动创建。

trans-unit.source: This command concatenates passed arguments and evaluates the resulting script under the mutex protection . If no mutex is specified by using the ?-lock mutex? optional argument, the internal static mutex is used .
trans-unit.target: 这条命令将通过的参数连接起来,并在mutex保护下评估产生的脚本。如果使用"-lock mutex? "可选参数没有指定mutex,则使用内部静态mutex。

trans-unit.source: This command creates a thread that contains a Tcl interpreter . The Tcl interpreter either evaluates the optional script, if specified, or it waits in the event loop for scripts that arrive via the thread::send command . The result, if any, of the optional script is never returned to the caller . The result of thread::create is the ID of the thread . This is the opaque handle which identifies the newly created thread for all other package commands . The handle of the thread goes out of scope automatically when thread is marked for exit (see the thread::release command below) .
trans-unit.target: 此命令创建一个包含Tcl解释器的线程。 Tcl解释器要么评估可选脚本（如果已指定），要么在事件循环中等待通过thread :: send命令到达的脚本。可选脚本的结果（如果有）永远不会返回给调用者。thread :: create的结果是thread的ID。这是不透明的句柄，用于标识所有其他包命令的新创建的线程。当线程标记为退出时，线程的句柄自动超出范围（请参见下面的thread :: release命令）。

trans-unit.source: This command creates an alias between one slave and another (see the alias slave command below for creating aliases between a slave and its master). In this command, either of the slave interpreters may be anywhere in the hierarchy of interpreters under the interpreter invoking the command.
trans-unit.target: 该命令在一个从站和另一个从站之间创建一个别名（有关在从站和它的主站之间创建别名的信息，请参见下面的alias slave命令）。在此命令中，任一从属解释器都可以在调用命令的解释器下的解释器层次结构中的任何位置。

trans-unit.source: This command creates many-readers/single-writer mutexes . Reader/writer mutexes allow you to serialize access to a shared resource more optimally . In situations where a shared resource gets mostly read and seldom modified, you might gain some performace by using reader/writer mutexes instead of exclusive or recursive mutexes .
trans-unit.target: 该命令可以创建多读取器/单写入器互斥。阅读者/写入者mutexes允许你更优化地序列化访问共享资源。在共享资源大部分被读取而很少被修改的情况下,使用读者/写者互斥而不是独占或递归互斥可能会获得一些性能。

trans-unit.source: This command creates new threadpool . It accepts several options as key-value pairs . Options are used to tune some threadpool parameters . The command returns the ID of the newly created threadpool .
trans-unit.target: 该命令创建新的线程池。它接受几个选项作为键值对。选项用于调整一些线程池参数。该命令返回新创建的线程池的ID。

trans-unit.source: This command decrements the thread reference counter . Each call to this command decrements the reference counter by one (1) . If called with the optional thread id, the command releases the given thread . Otherwise, the current thread is released . Command returns the value of the reference counter after the decrement . When the reference counter reaches zero (0), the target thread is marked for termination . You should not reference the thread after the thread::release command returns zero or negative integer . The handle of the thread goes out of scope and should not be used any more . Any following reference to the same thread handle will result in Tcl error .
trans-unit.target: 该命令递减线程引用计数器。对该命令的每次调用都会使参考计数器减一（1）。如果使用可选的线程ID调用，该命令将释放给定的线程。否则，释放当前线程。递减后，命令将返回参考计数器的值。当参考计数器达到零（0）时，目标线程将标记为终止。在thread :: release命令返回零或负整数之后，您不应引用该线程。线程的句柄超出范围，不应再使用。以下对同一线程句柄的任何引用都将导致Tcl错误。

trans-unit.source: This command implements simple pointer and keyboard grabs for Tk. Tk's grabs are different than the grabs described in the Xlib documentation. When a grab is set for a particular window, Tk restricts all pointer events to the grab window and its descendants in Tk's window hierarchy. Whenever the pointer is within the grab window's subtree, the pointer will behave exactly the same as if there had been no grab at all and all events will be reported in the normal fashion. When the pointer is outside

Command returns the value of the reference counter after the increment . If called with the optional thread id, the command preserves the given thread . Otherwise the current thread is preserved .

trans-unit.source: This command installs a script that will be called when interesting life cycle events occur for a safe interpreter. When called with no arguments, it returns the currently installed script. When called with one argument, an empty string, the currently installed script is removed and logging is turned off. The script will be invoked with one additional argument, a string describing the event of interest. The main purpose is to help in debugging safe interpreters. Using this facility you can get complete error messages while the safe interpreter gets only generic error messages. This prevents a safe interpreter from seeing messages about failures and other events that might contain sensitive information such as real directory names.
trans-unit.target: 该命令安装了一个脚本,当安全解释器发生有趣的生命周期事件时,该脚本将被调用。当调用时没有参数时,它将返回当前安装的脚本。当调用时有一个参数,即一个空字符串时,当前安装的脚本将被删除,日志记录将被关闭。脚本将被调用一个额外的参数,一个描述感兴趣事件的字符串。主要目的是帮助调试安全解释器。使用这个设施,你可以得到完整的错误信息,而安全解释器只得到通用的错误信息。这可以防止安全解释器看到关于失败的消息和其他可能包含敏感信息(如真实目录名)的事件。

trans-unit.source: This command is invoked by the Tcl interpreter whenever a script tries to invoke a command that does not exist. The default implementation of unknown is a library procedure defined when Tcl initializes an interpreter. You can override the default unknown to change its functionality, or you can register a new handler for individual namespaces using the namespace unknown command. Note that there is no default implementation of unknown in a safe interpreter.

trans-unit.source: This command is typically invoked by Tcl code that wishes to use a particular version of a particular package. The arguments indicate which package is wanted, and the command ensures that a suitable version of the package is loaded into the interpreter. If the command succeeds, it returns the version number that is loaded; otherwise it generates an error.
trans-unit.target: 这条命令通常是由希望使用特定包的特定版本的Tcl代码调用的。参数表明想要使用的是哪个软件包,而该命令则确保一个合适的软件包版本被加载到解释器中。如果命令成功,则返回被加载的版本号;否则会产生一个错误。

trans-unit.source: This command is typically invoked inside the body of a looping command such as for or foreach or while. It returns a 3 (TCL_BREAK) result code, which causes a break exception to occur. The exception causes the current script to be aborted out to the innermost containing loop command, which then aborts its execution and returns normally. Break exceptions are also handled in a few other situations, such as the catch command, Tk event bindings, and the outermost scripts of procedure bodies.
trans-unit.target: 通常在诸如for或foreach或while的循环命令的主体内部调用此命令。它返回3（TCL_BREAK）结果代码，这将导致发生中断异常。异常导致当前脚本被中止至最里面的包含循环的命令，然后该脚本中止其执行并正常返回。中断异常也可以在其他一些情况下处理，例如catch命令，Tk事件绑定和过程主体的最外层脚本。

trans-unit.source: This command is typically invoked inside the body of a looping command such as for or foreach or while. It returns a 4 (TCL_CONTINUE) result code, which causes a continue exception to occur. The exception causes the current script to be aborted out to the innermost containing loop command, which then continues with the next iteration of the loop. Catch exceptions are also handled in a few other situations, such as the catch command and the outermost scripts of procedure bodies.
trans-unit.target: 通常在诸如for或foreach或while的循环命令的主体内部调用此命令。它返回一个4（TCL_CONTINUE）结果代码，这将导致继续异常发生。该异常导致当前脚本被中止至包含最里面的循环命令，然后该命令继续循环的下一次迭代。在其他一些情况下也可以处理catch异常，例如catch命令和过程主体的最外层脚本。

trans-unit.source: This command keeps a simple database of the packages available for use by the current interpreter and how to load them into the interpreter. It supports multiple versions of each package and arranges for the correct version of a package to be loaded based on what is needed by the application. This command also detects and reports version clashes. Typically, only the package require and package provide commands are invoked in normal Tcl scripts; the other commands are used primarily by system scripts that maintain the package database.

trans-unit.source: This command opens a network socket and returns a channel identifier that may be used in future invocations of commands like read, puts and flush. At present only the TCP network protocol is supported over IPv4 and IPv6; future releases may include support for additional protocols. The socket command may be used to open either the client or server side of a connection, depending on whether the -server switch is specified.

trans-unit.source: This command provides a Tcl interface to the Tk clipboard, which stores data for later retrieval using the selection mechanism (via the -selection CLIPBOARD option). In order to copy data into the clipboard, clipboard clear must be called, followed by a sequence of one or more calls to clipboard append. To ensure that the clipboard is updated atomically, all appends should be completed before returning to the event loop.

trans-unit.source: This command provides facilities for manipulating binary data. The subcommand binary format creates a binary string from normal Tcl values. For example, given the values 16 and 22, on a 32-bit architecture, it might produce an 8-byte binary string consisting of two 4-byte integers, one for each of the numbers. The subcommand binary scan, does the opposite: it extracts data from a binary string and returns it as ordinary Tcl string values. The binary encode and binary decode subcommands convert binary data to or from string encodings such as base64 (used in MIME messages for example).
trans-unit.target: 此命令提供了用于处理二进制数据的工具。子命令二进制格式根据常规Tcl值创建二进制字符串。例如，给定值16和22，在32位体系结构上，它可能会产生一个8字节的二进制字符串，该字符串由两个4字节的整数组成，每个数字一个。子命令binary scan的作用与此相反：它从二进制字符串中提取数据，并将其作为普通Tcl字符串值返回。的二进制编码和二进制解码子二进制数据转换成或从字符串的编码如BASE64（在MIME消息中使用例如）。

trans-unit.source: This command provides script-level access to condition variables . A condition variable creates a safe environment for the program to test some condition, sleep on it when false and be awakened when it might have become true . A condition variable is always used in the conjuction with an exclusive mutex . If you attempt to use other type of mutex in conjuction with the condition variable, a Tcl error will be thrown .
trans-unit.target: 这个命令提供了对条件变量的脚本级访问。条件变量为程序创造了一个安全的环境来测试某些条件,当它为假时,它就沉睡,当它可能变成真时,它就被唤醒。条件变量总是与独占性的互斥连接在一起使用。如果你试图在条件变量的连接中使用其他类型的mutex,那么会产生一个Tcl错误。

trans-unit.source: This command stops a prior thread::wait command . Execution of the script passed to newly created thread will continue from the thread::wait command . If thread::wait was the last command in the script, the thread will exit . The command returns empty result but may trigger Tcl error with the message "target thread died" in some situations .
trans-unit.target: 该命令停止先前的thread :: wait命令。传递给新创建的线程的脚本将从thread :: wait命令继续执行。如果thread :: wait是脚本中的最后一个命令，则线程将退出。该命令返回空结果，但在某些情况下可能会触发Tcl错误，并显示消息“目标线程已死亡”。

trans-unit.source: This command supports most of the options of the standard Tcl array command . In addition to those, it allows binding a shared variable to some persisten storage databases . Currently the persistent options supported are the famous GNU Gdbm and LMDB . These options have to be selected during the package compilation time . The implementation provides hooks for defining other persistency layers, if needed .
trans-unit.target: 该命令支持标准Tcl array命令的大多数选项。除此之外，它还允许将共享变量绑定到一些持久存储数据库。当前支持的持久性选项是著名的GNU Gdbm和LMDB。在软件包编译期间必须选择这些选项。如果需要，该实现提供了用于定义其他持久性层的钩子。

trans-unit.source: This command takes an identifier as returned by platform::identify and returns a list of identifiers describing compatible architectures.
trans-unit.target: 该命令采用platform :: identify返回的标识符，并返回描述兼容体系结构的标识符列表。

trans-unit.source: This command takes the contents of the specified file or resource and passes it to the Tcl interpreter as a text script. The return value from source is the return value of the last command executed in the script. If an error occurs in evaluating the contents of the script then the source command will return that error. If a return command is invoked from within the script then the remainder of the file will be skipped and the source command will return normally with the result from the return command.
trans-unit.target: 此命令获取指定文件或资源的内容，并将其作为文本脚本传递给Tcl解释器。从返回值源是脚本中最后执行的命令的返回值。如果评估脚本的内容时发生错误，那么source命令将返回该错误。如果从脚本中调用了return命令，则文件的其余部分将被跳过，并且source命令将正常返回return命令的结果。

trans-unit.source: This command takes three arguments, the first a two-element list of variable names (for the key and value respectively of each mapping in the dictionary), the second the dictionary value to iterate across, and the third a script to be evaluated for each mapping with the key and value variables set appropriately (in the manner of foreach.) The result of the command is an empty string. If any evaluation of the body generates a TCL_BREAK result, no further pairs from the dictionary will be iterated over and the dict for command will terminate successfully immediately. If any evaluation of the body generates a TCL_CONTINUE result, this shall be treated exactly like a normal TCL_OK result. The order of iteration is the order in which the keys were inserted into the dictionary.
trans-unit.target: 此命令带有三个参数，第一个是变量名称的两元素列表（分别用于字典中每个映射的键和值），第二个用于迭代的字典值，第三个是每个变量要评估的脚本使用适当设置的键和值变量进行映射（以foreach的方式）。命令的结果为空字符串。如果对正文的任何​​评估产生了TCL_BREAK结果，则不会重复访问字典中的其他对，并且dict for命令将立即成功终止。如果对人体的任何评估产生了TCL_CONTINUE结果，则应将其视为正常的TCL_OK结果。迭代顺序是将关键字插入字典的顺序。

trans-unit.source: This enters the event loop so a thread can receive messages from the thread::send command . This command should only be used within the script passed to the thread::create . It should be the very last command in the script . If this is not the case, the exiting thread will continue executing the script lines past the thread::wait which is usually not what you want and/or expect .
trans-unit.target: 这进入事件循环，因此线程可以从thread :: send命令接收消息。此命令仅应在传递给thread :: create的脚本内使用。它应该是脚本中的最后一个命令。如果不是这种情况，则退出的线程将继续执行线程：: wait之后的脚本行，通常这不是您想要和/或期望的。

trans-unit.source: This entry is always present and describes the nature of the location for the command. The recognized values are source, proc, eval, and precompiled.
trans-unit.target: 该条目始终存在，并描述命令位置的性质。公认的值是source，proc，eval和预编译的。

trans-unit.source: This entry is present only for type source. It provides the normalized path of the file the command is in.
trans-unit.target: 该条目仅对于类型source才存在。它提供命令所在文件的标准化路径。

trans-unit.source: This entry is present only if the command is found in the body of a regular Tcl procedure. It then provides the name of that procedure.
trans-unit.target: 只有当该命令出现在一个常规Tcl存储过程的主体中时,才会出现该条目。然后,它提供了这个过程的名称。

trans-unit.source: This entry is present only if the command is found in the body of an anonymous Tcl procedure, i.e. a lambda. It then provides the entire definition of the lambda in question.

trans-unit.source: This entry is present only if the queried frame has a corresponding frame returned by info level. It provides the index of this frame, relative to the current level (0 and negative numbers).
trans-unit.target: 仅当查询的帧具有由信息级别返回的相应帧时，此条目才存在。它提供此帧相对于当前级别的索引（0和负数）。

trans-unit.source: This entry provides the number of the line the command is at inside of the script it is a part of. This information is not present for type precompiled. For type source this information is counted relative to the beginning of the file, whereas for the last two types the line is counted relative to the start of the script.
trans-unit.target: 此项提供命令所在脚本行中的行号。预编译类型不存在此信息。对于类型源，此信息相对于文件的开头进行计数，而对于最后两种类型，行相对于脚本的开始进行计数。

trans-unit.source: This entry provides the string representation of the command. This is usually the unsubstituted form, however for commands which are a canonically-constructed list (e.g., as produced by the list command) executed by eval it is the substituted form as they have no other string representation. Care is taken that the canonicality property of the latter is not spoiled.
trans-unit.target: 此项提供命令的字符串表示形式。这通常是非替换形式，但是对于由eval执行的规范构造的列表（例如，由list命令生成）的命令，由于它们没有其他字符串表示形式，因此是替换形式。注意不要破坏后者的规范性。

trans-unit.source: This environment variable, if set, gives the location of the directory considered to be the current user's home directory, and to which a call of cd without arguments or with just “~” as an argument will change into. trans-unit.source: This form (mnemonically the mirror of d) is the same as d except that it stores the double-precision floating point numbers in little-endian order. This conversion only produces meaningful output when used on machines which use the IEEE floating point representation (very common, but not universal.)
trans-unit.target: 这种形式的（的mnemonically镜d）是相同的d除了它存储双精度浮点数little-endian顺序。仅当在使用IEEE浮点表示的机器上使用此转换时，此转换才产生有意义的输出（非常常见，但不通用）。

trans-unit.source: This form (mnemonically the mirror of w) is the same as w and W except that it stores the 64-bit integers in the output string in the native byte order of the machine where the Tcl script is running. To determine what the native byte order of the machine is, refer to the byteOrder element of the tcl_platform array.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式（通常是w的镜像）与w和W相同，不同之处在于它以运行Tcl脚本的计算机的本机字节顺序在输出字符串中存储64位整数。要确定计算机的本机字节顺序是什么，请参考tcl_platform数组的byteOrder元素。

trans-unit.source: This form delegates all unknown options to the specified component. The except clause can be used to specify a list of exceptions, i.e., option names that will not be so delegated.

trans-unit.source: This form is an even-sized list alternating tokens and parameters. Tokens are currently either CALL, UP, or INNER, but other values may be introduced in the future. CALL indicates a procedure call, and its parameter is the corresponding info level0. UP indicates a shift in variable frames generated by uplevel or similar, and applies to the previous CALL item. Its parameter is the level offset. INNER identifies the “inner context”, which is the innermost atomic command or bytecode instruction that raised the error, along with its arguments when available. While CALL and UP allow to follow complex call paths, INNER homes in on the offending operation in the innermost procedure call, even going to sub-expression granularity.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式是一个均匀大小的列表，交替使用令牌和参数。令牌当前为CALL，UP或INNER，但将来可能会引入其他值。CALL指示过程调用，其参数为相应的信息级别0。UP指示由上级或类似内容生成的可变帧中的偏移，并应用于上一个CALL项。它的参数是电平偏移。INNER标识“内部上下文”，它是引发错误的最里面的原子命令或字节码指令，以及可用的参数。虽然CALL由于UP和UP允许遵循复杂的调用路径，因此INNER会在最内部的过程调用中加入令人反感的操作，甚至是子表达式粒度。

trans-unit.target: 这种形式称为“有界”。

trans-unit.target: 这种形式称为“最小限度”。

trans-unit.source: This form is called “min-unbound”.
trans-unit.target: 这种形式称为“最小无限制”。

trans-unit.source: This form is the same as c except that it stores one or more one or more single-precision floating point numbers in the machine's native representation in the output string. This representation is not portable across architectures, so it should not be used to communicate floating point numbers across the network. The size of a floating point number may vary across architectures, so the number of bytes that are generated may vary. If the value overflows the machine's native representation, then the value of FLT_MAX as defined by the system will be used instead. Because Tcl uses double-precision floating point numbers internally, there may be some loss of precision in the conversion to single-precision. For example, on a Windows system running on an Intel Pentium processor,
trans-unit.target: 该形式与c相同，除了它在输出字符串的计算机本机表示形式中存储一个或多个一个或多个单精度浮点数。此表示不能跨体系结构移植，因此不应用于在网络上传递浮点数。浮点数的大小可能会因体系结构而异，因此生成的字节数可能会有所不同。如果该值溢出了计算机的本机表示，则将使用系统定义的FLT_MAX的值。由于Tcl在内部使用双精度浮点数，因此在转换为单精度时可能会损失一些精度。例如，在运行Intel Pentium处理器的Windows系统上，

trans-unit.source: This is the compatible way to do menu bars. You create one menubutton widget for each top-level menu, and typically you arrange a series of menubuttons in a row in a menubar window. You also create the top-level menus and any cascaded submenus, and tie them together with -menu options in menubuttons and cascade menu entries. The top-level menu must be a child of the menubutton, and each submenu must be a child of the menu that refers to it. Once you have done this, the default bindings will allow users to traverse and invoke the tree of menus via its menubutton; see the menubutton manual entry for details.
trans-unit.target: 这是菜单栏的兼容方式。您为每个顶级菜单创建一个menubutton小部件，通常，您会在菜单栏窗口的一行中排列一系列菜单按钮。您还可以创建顶级菜单和所有级联的子菜单，并将它们与菜单按钮和级联菜单项中的-menu选项绑定在一起。顶层菜单必须是menubutton的子菜单，每个子菜单必须是引用它的菜单的子菜单。完成此操作后，默认绑定将允许用户通过其菜单按钮遍历并调用菜单树。有关详细信息，请参见菜单按钮的手动输入。

trans-unit.source: This is the message folder of the package. This option is set by mcload and by the subcommand set. Both are identical and both return the number of loaded message catalog files.
trans-unit.target: 这是该软件包的消息文件夹。这个选项是由mcload和子命令set设置的。两者都是相同的,都返回加载的消息目录文件的数量。

trans-unit.source: This is the most common case. You create a menu widget that will become the menu bar. You then add cascade entries to this menu, specifying the pull down menus you wish to use in your menu bar. You then create all of the pulldowns. Once you have done this, specify the menu using the -menu option of the toplevel's widget command. See the toplevel manual entry for details.
trans-unit.target: 这是最常见的情况。您创建一个菜单小部件，它将成为菜单栏。然后，您可以在此菜单中添加级联条目，并指定要在菜单栏中使用的下拉菜单。然后，您创建所有下拉菜单。完成此操作后，请使用顶层窗口小部件命令的-menu选项指定菜单。有关详细信息，请参见顶级手动条目。

Other commands, as desribed below, are included mostly for the sake of completeness .

trans-unit.source: This manual describes common widget options and commands.
trans-unit.target: 本手册介绍了常见的小组件选项和命令。

trans-unit.source: This manual entry describes the common configuration options supported by widgets in the Tk toolkit. Every widget does not necessarily support every option (see the manual entries for individual widgets for a list of the standard options supported by that widget), but if a widget does support an option with one of the names listed below, then the option has exactly the effect described below.
trans-unit.target: 本手册条目描述了 Tk 工具包中小组件支持的常见配置选项。每个小组件不一定支持每个选项(请参阅各个小组件的手册条目,以了解该小组件支持的标准选项列表),但如果一个小组件确实支持具有下列名称之一的选项,则该选项具有下文所述的确切效果。

trans-unit.source: This manual page primarily describes AREs. BREs mostly exist for backward compatibility in some old programs; they will be discussed at the end. POSIX EREs are almost an exact subset of AREs. Features of AREs that are not present in EREs will be indicated.
trans-unit.target: 本手册页主要介绍ARRE。BREs主要是为了在一些旧程序中向后兼容而存在的,它们将在最后讨论。POSIX EREs几乎是AREs的一个精确子集。AREs的特征在ERE中是不存在的,会被指出。

trans-unit.source: This must be a Tcl list of values. If this option is set then this will override any range set using the -from, -to and -increment options. The widget will instead use the values specified beginning with the first value.
trans-unit.target: 这必须是Tcl值列表。如果设置了此选项，则它将覆盖使用-from，-to和-increment选项设置的任何范围。小部件将改用从第一个值开始指定的值。

trans-unit.source: This negates the sense of the match, returning the index of the first non-matching value in the list.
trans-unit.target: 这否定了匹配的意义,返回列表中第一个非匹配值的索引。

trans-unit.target: 这不仅能正确地格式化命令,还能捕捉到它的命名空间上下文。

trans-unit.source: This opens a file using a known encoding (CP1252, a very common encoding on Windows), searches for a string, rewrites that part, and truncates the file after a further two lines.
trans-unit.target: 这将打开一个使用已知编码的文件(CP1252,Windows上非常常见的编码),搜索一个字符串,重写该部分,并在另外两行之后截断文件。

trans-unit.source: This operation (the companion to dict set) takes the name of a variable containing a dictionary value and places an updated dictionary value in that variable that does not contain a mapping for the given key. Where multiple keys are present, this describes a path through nested dictionaries to the mapping to remove. At least one key must be specified, but the last key on the key-path need not exist. All other components on the path must exist. The updated dictionary value is returned.
trans-unit.target: 此操作（dict set的同伴）采用包含字典值的变量的名称，并将更新的字典值放置在该变量中，该变量不包含给定键的映射。在存在多个键的情况下，这描述了从嵌套字典到要删除的映射的路径。至少必须指定一个密钥，但是密钥路径上的最后一个密钥不必存在。路径上的所有其他组件必须存在。返回更新的字典值。

trans-unit.source: This operation takes the name of a variable containing a dictionary value and places an updated dictionary value in that variable containing a mapping from the given key to the given value. When multiple keys are present, this operation creates or updates a chain of nested dictionaries. The updated dictionary value is returned.
trans-unit.target: 这个操作接收一个包含字典值的变量名,并将更新后的字典值放入该变量中,其中包含从给定键到给定值的映射。当存在多个键时,此操作创建或更新一个嵌套字典链。返回更新后的字典值。

trans-unit.source: This option (common for all limit types) specifies (if non-empty) a Tcl script to be executed in the global namespace of the interpreter reading and writing the option when the particular limit in the limited interpreter is exceeded. The callback may modify the limit on the interpreter if it wishes the limited interpreter to continue executing. If the callback generates an exception, it is reported through the background exception mechanism (see BACKGROUND EXCEPTION HANDLING). Note that the callbacks defined by one interpreter are completely isolated from the callbacks defined by another, and that the order in which those callbacks are called is undefined.
trans-unit.target: 此选项（对于所有限制类型都是通用的）指定（如果非空的话）要在解释器的全局名称空间中执行的Tcl脚本，当超出限制的解释器中的特定限制时，读写该选项。如果回调函数希望受限的解释器继续执行，则可以修改解释器的限制。如果回调产生异常，则会通过后台异常机制进行报告（请参阅Background Exception Handling）。请注意，一个解释器定义的回调与另一个解释器定义的回调完全隔离，并且这些回调的调用顺序是不确定的。

trans-unit.source: This option (common for all limit types) specifies how frequently (out of the points when the Tcl interpreter is in a consistent state where limit checking is possible) that the limit is actually checked. This allows the tuning of how frequently a limit is checked, and hence how often the limit-checking overhead (which may be substantial in the case of time limits) is incurred.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项(所有限值类型都通用)指定了限值实际被检查的频率(在Tcl解释器处于可以进行限值检查的一致状态时)。这允许调整极限检查的频率,从而调整极限检查开销的频率(在时间限制的情况下,开销可能很大)。

trans-unit.source: This option (only legal when -regexp is also specified) specifies the name of a variable into which the list of indices referring to matching substrings found by the regular expression engine will be written. The first element of the list written will be a two-element list specifying the index of the start and index of the first character after the end of the overall substring of the input string (i.e. the
trans-unit.target: 此选项（仅当同时指定-regexp时才合法）指定变量的名称，将把引用由正则表达式引擎找到的匹配子字符串的索引列表写入其中。写入的列表的第一个元素将是一个由两个元素组成的列表，该列表指定输入字符串的整个子字符串的末尾的第一个字符的开始索引和索引（即

trans-unit.source: This option (only legal when -regexp is also specified) specifies the name of a variable into which the list of matches found by the regular expression engine will be written. The first element of the list written will be the overall substring of the input string (i.e. the
trans-unit.target: 此选项（仅当同时指定-regexp时才合法）指定将正则表达式引擎找到的匹配列表写入其中的变量的名称。写入列表的第一个元素将是输入字符串的整体子字符串（即

trans-unit.source: This option (which is enabled by default) controls whether the ensemble command recognizes unambiguous prefixes of its subcommands. When turned off, the ensemble command requires exact matching of subcommand names.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项(默认情况下是启用的)控制ensemble命令是否识别其子命令的明确前缀。当关闭时,合集命令要求子命令名完全匹配。

trans-unit.source: This option can be one of menubar, tearoff, or normal, and is set when the menu is created. While the string returned by the configuration database will change if this option is changed, this does not affect the menu widget's behavior. This is used by the cloning mechanism and is not normally set outside of the Tk library.
trans-unit.target: 此选项可以是menubar，tearoff或normal之一，并且在创建菜单时设置。如果更改此选项，则配置数据库返回的字符串将更改，但这不会影响菜单小部件的行为。这是由克隆机制使用的，通常不在Tk库之外设置。

trans-unit.source: This option determines whether or with what priority an SSL connection will be negotiated with the server. There are four
trans-unit.target: 这个选项决定是否或以什么优先级与服务器协商SSL连接。有四个

trans-unit.source: This option gets the current error status of the given socket. This is useful when you need to determine if an asynchronous connect operation succeeded. If there was an error, the error message is returned. If there was no error, an empty string is returned.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项可以获取给定套接字的当前错误状态。当你需要确定异步连接操作是否成功时,这个选项很有用。如果有错误,则返回错误信息。如果没有错误,则返回一个空字符串。

trans-unit.source: This option gives a list of named arguments (the names being used during generation of error messages) that are passed by the caller of the ensemble between the name of the ensemble and the subcommand argument. By default, it is the empty list.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项给出了一个名为参数的列表(生成错误信息时使用的名称),由合集的调用者在合集名称和子命令参数之间传递。默认情况下,它是一个空列表。

trans-unit.source: This option indicates how to draw arrowheads. The
trans-unit.target: 该选项指示如何绘制箭头。该

trans-unit.source: This option is a convenience shortcut for -nested true and thus specifies the safe interpreter will be allowed to load packages into its own sub-interpreters.
trans-unit.target: 此选项是-nested true的便捷快捷方式，因此指定将允许安全解释器将程序包加载到其自己的子解释器中。

trans-unit.source: This option is a convenience shortcut for -statics false and thus specifies that the safe interpreter will not be allowed to load statically linked packages.
trans-unit.target: 此选项是-statics false的便捷快捷方式，因此指定不允许安全解释器加载静态链接的程序包。

trans-unit.source: This option is a set of 4 comma-separated values: the baud rate, parity, number of data bits, and number of stop bits for this serial port. The
trans-unit.target: 这个选项是一组4个以逗号分隔的值:该串口的波特率、奇偶校验、数据位数和停止位数。该

trans-unit.target: 不建议使用此选项，而建议使用-sslmode设置。的

trans-unit.target: 这个选项是为了在嵌套列表中搜索时使用。嵌套列表中的

trans-unit.source: This option is ignored on never servers. Formerly this specified where to send debug output. This option is left for compatibility with older servers.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项在never服务器上被忽略。以前这个选项指定了发送调试输出的位置。这个选项是为了与旧服务器兼容而保留的。

trans-unit.source: This option is mutually exclusive with the -finalize and -flush options.
trans-unit.target: 此选项与-finalize和-flush选项互斥。

trans-unit.source: This option is mutually exclusive with the -finalize and -fullflush options.
trans-unit.target: 此选项与-finalize和-fullflush选项互斥。

trans-unit.source: This option is mutually exclusive with the -flush and -fullflush options.
trans-unit.target: 此选项与-flush和-fullflush选项互斥。

trans-unit.source: This option is not supported by server sockets. For client and accepted sockets, this option returns a list of three elements; these are the address, the host name and the port to which the peer socket is connected or bound. If the host name cannot be computed, the second element of the list is identical to the address, its first element.
trans-unit.target: 服务器套接字不支持这个选项。对于客户端和已接受的套接字,这个选项返回一个由三个元素组成的列表;这三个元素是地址、主机名和对等套接字连接或绑定的端口。如果主机名无法计算,则列表中的第二个元素与其第一个元素--地址相同。

trans-unit.source: This option is not supported by server sockets. For client sockets, this option returns 1 if an asyncroneous connect is still in progress, 0 otherwise.
trans-unit.target: 服务器套接字不支持这个选项。对于客户端套接字,如果异步连接仍在进行中,这个选项返回1,否则返回0。

trans-unit.source: This option is the same as the standard -background option except that its value may also be specified as an empty string. In this case, the widget will display no background or border, and no colors will be consumed from its colormap for its background and border.
trans-unit.target: 此选项与标准-background选项相同，除了它的值也可以指定为空字符串。在这种情况下，小部件将不显示背景或边框，并且不会从其颜色图中消耗其背景和边框的颜色。

trans-unit.source: This option is used for embedding. If the value is not an empty string, it must be the window identifier of a container window, specified as a hexadecimal string like the ones returned by the winfo id command. The toplevel widget will be created as a child of the given container instead of the root window for the screen. If the container window is in a Tk application, it must be a frame or toplevel widget for which the -container option was specified. This option may not be changed with the configure widget command.
trans-unit.target: 此选项用于嵌入。如果该值不是空字符串，则它必须是容器窗口的窗口标识符，指定为十六进制字符串，类似于winfo id命令返回的字符串。顶级小部件将被创建为给定容器的子级，而不是屏幕的根窗口。如果容器窗口在Tk应用程序中，则它必须是为其指定了-container选项的框架或顶级窗口小部件。不能使用configure widget命令更改此选项。

trans-unit.source: This option is used to add headers not already specified by ::http::config to the HTTP request. The
trans-unit.target: 此选项用于将:: http :: config尚未指定的标头添加到HTTP请求。的

trans-unit.source: This option is used to specify the encoding of the channel as one of the named encodings returned by encoding names or the special value binary, so that the data can be converted to and from Unicode for use in Tcl. For instance, in order for Tcl to read characters from a Japanese file in shiftjis and properly process and display the contents, the encoding would be set to shiftjis. Thereafter, when reading from the channel, the bytes in the Japanese file would be converted to Unicode as they are read. Writing is also supported - as Tcl strings are written to the channel they will automatically be converted to the specified encoding on output.
trans-unit.target: 此选项用于将通道的编码指定为编码名称或特殊值二进制返回的命名编码之一，以便可以在Tcl中使用Unicode来回转换数据。例如，为了使Tcl从shiftjis中的日语文件中读取字符并正确处理和显示内容，可以将编码设置为shiftjis。此后，从通道读取时，日语文件中的字节将在读取时转换为Unicode。还支持写入-将Tcl字符串写入通道后，它们会在输出时自动转换为指定的编码。

trans-unit.source: This option is used to specify the encoding of the channel, so that the data can be converted to and from Unicode for use in Tcl. For instance, in order for Tcl to read characters from a Japanese file in shiftjis and properly process and display the contents, the encoding would be set to shiftjis. Thereafter, when reading from the channel, the bytes in the Japanese file would be converted to Unicode as they are read. Writing is also supported - as Tcl strings are written to the channel they will automatically be converted to the specified encoding on output.
trans-unit.target: 此选项用于指定通道的编码，以便可以将数据与Unicode相互转换以便在Tcl中使用。例如，为了使Tcl从shiftjis中的日语文件中读取字符并正确处理和显示内容，可以将编码设置为shiftjis。此后，从通道读取时，日语文件中的字节将在读取时转换为Unicode。还支持写入-将Tcl字符串写入通道后，它们会在输出时自动转换为指定的编码。

trans-unit.source: This option must have a proper boolean value, which specifies whether or not the menu should include a tear-off entry at the top. If so, it will exist as entry 0 of the menu and the other entries will number starting at 1. The default menu bindings arrange for the menu to be torn off when the tear-off entry is invoked. This option is ignored under Aqua/Mac OS X, where menus cannot be torn off.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项必须有一个适当的布尔值,它指定菜单是否应该在顶部包含一个撕掉条目,如果是,它将作为菜单的0条目存在,其他条目将从1开始编号。默认的菜单绑定会在调用撕掉条目时将菜单撕掉。在Aqua/Mac OS X下,该选项被忽略,因为在Aqua/Mac OS X下,菜单不能被撕掉。

trans-unit.source: This option sets the list of directories from which the safe interpreter can source and load files. If this option is not specified, or if it is given as the empty list, the safe interpreter will use the same directories as its master for auto-loading. See the section SECURITY below for more detail about virtual paths, tokens and access control.
trans-unit.target: 此选项设置从安全解释器的目录列表中源和负载文件。如果未指定此选项，或者将其指定为空列表，则安全解释器将使用与其主目录相同的目录进行自动加载。有关虚拟路径，令牌和访问控制的更多详细信息，请参见下面的“ 安全性 ”部分。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies dash patterns for the normal, active state, and disabled state of an item.
trans-unit.target: 此选项用于指定项目的正常、活动状态和禁用状态的破折号图案。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies if the safe interpreter will be allowed to load packages into its own sub-interpreters. The default value is false : safe interpreters are not allowed to load packages into their own sub-interpreters.
trans-unit.target: 此选项指定是否允许安全解释器将程序包加载到其自己的子解释器中。缺省值为false：不允许安全解释器将程序包加载到它们自己的子解释器中。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies if the safe interpreter will be allowed to load statically linked packages (like load {} Tk). The default value is true : safe interpreters are allowed to load statically linked packages.
trans-unit.target: 此选项指定是否允许安全解释器加载静态链接的程序包（如load {} Tk）。默认值为true：允许安全解释器加载静态链接的程序包。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies stipple patterns that should be used to draw the outline of the item in its normal, active and disabled states. Indicates that the outline for the item should be drawn with a stipple pattern;
trans-unit.target: 此选项指定在正常、活动和禁用状态下,应使用点阵图案来绘制项目的轮廓。表示项目的轮廓应该用波纹图案绘制。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies stipple patterns that should be used to fill the item in its normal, active and disabled states.
trans-unit.target: 此选项指定在正常、活动和禁用状态下应使用的点阵图案来填充项目。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies the color that should be used to draw the outline of the item in its normal, active and disabled states.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项指定了在正常、活动和禁用状态下应该使用的颜色来绘制项目的轮廓。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies the number of commands that the interpreter may execute before triggering the command limit. This option may be the empty string, which indicates that a command limit is not set for the interpreter.
trans-unit.target: 这个选项指定了解释器在触发命令限制之前可以执行的命令数量。这个选项可以是空字符串,表示没有为解释器设置命令限制。

trans-unit.source: This option specifies the number of milliseconds after the moment defined in the -seconds option that the time limit will fire. It should only ever be specified in conjunction with the -seconds option (whether it was set previously or is being set this invocation.)
trans-unit.target: 此选项指定在-seconds选项中定义的时间限制触发后经过的毫秒数。只能将它与-seconds选项一起指定（无论是先前设置的还是此调用设置的。）

trans-unit.source: This option specifies the number of seconds after the epoch (see clock seconds) that the time limit for the interpreter will be triggered. The limit will be triggered at the start of the second unless specified at a sub-second level using the -milliseconds option. This option may be the empty string, which indicates that a time limit is not set for the interpreter.
trans-unit.target: 此选项指定在触发解释器的时间限制的纪元后的秒数（请参阅clock seconds）。除非使用-milliseconds选项在亚秒级别上指定，否则该限制将在秒的开始处触发。此选项可以是空字符串，表示未为解释器设置时间限制。

trans-unit.source: This option supports DOS file systems that use Control-z (\x1a) as an end of file marker. If
trans-unit.target: 这个选项支持使用Control-z (\x1a)作为文件结束标记的DOS文件系统。如果

trans-unit.source: This option typically consists of a two-element list, containing the name of a scrollable widget followed by either xview (for horizontal scrollbars) or yview (for vertical scrollbars).
trans-unit.target: 此选项通常包含两个元素的列表，其中包含一个可滚动小部件的名称，后跟xview（用于水平滚动条）或yview（用于垂直滚动条）。

trans-unit.source: This option will cause the client socket to be connected asynchronously. This means that the socket will be created immediately but may not yet be connected to the server, when the call to socket returns.
trans-unit.target: 此选项将导致客户端套接字异步连接。这意味着当调用套接字返回时，套接字将立即创建，但可能尚未连接到服务器。

trans-unit.source: This optional subcommand is called to allow the Tcl I/O engine to determine how far ahead it should read. If present, it should return an integer number greater than zero which indicates how many bytes ahead should be read, or an integer less than zero to indicate that the I/O engine may read as far ahead as it likes.
trans-unit.target: 调用这个可选的子命令是为了让Tcl I/O引擎决定它应该提前多久读取。如果存在的话,它应该返回一个大于零的整数,表示应该提前多少字节读取,或者返回一个小于零的整数,表示I/O引擎可以随意提前读取。

trans-unit.source: This optional subcommand is called to signify to the transformation that any data stored in internal buffers (either incoming or outgoing) must be cleared. It is called when a chan seek is performed on the channel being transformed.
trans-unit.target: 调用此可选子命令表示转换为必须清除存储在内部缓冲区（传入或传出）中的所有数据。在要转换的通道上执行寻道时，将调用此方法。

trans-unit.source: This optional subcommand is called whenever data in the transformation 'write' buffer has to be forced downward, i.e. towards the base channel. The result returned by the subcommand is taken as the binary data to write to the transformation below the current transformation. This can be the base channel as well.
trans-unit.target: 每当变换 "写 "缓冲区中的数据必须向下强制写入时,即向基本通道写入时,就会调用该可选子命令。该子命令返回的结果是作为二进制数据写入当前变换下方的变换。这也可以是基本通道。

trans-unit.source: This optional subcommand is called whenever data in the transformation input (i.e. read) buffer has to be forced upward, i.e. towards the user or script. The result returned by the method is taken as the
trans-unit.target: 每当转换输入(即读取)缓冲区中的数据被强制向上移动时,即向用户或脚本移动时,就会调用这个可选的子命令。该方法返回的结果是作为

trans-unit.source: This package allows the identification of the architecture of a specific Tcl shell different from the shell running the package. The only requirement is that the other shell (identified by its path), is actually executable on the current machine.
trans-unit.target: 这个软件包允许识别与运行该软件包的shell不同的特定Tcl shell的结构。唯一的要求是另一个shell(由其路径识别),在当前机器上确实可以执行。

trans-unit.source: This package creates a framework for on-demand replication of the interpreter state accross threads in an multithreading application . It relies on the mechanics of Tcl command tracing and the Tcl unknown command and mechanism .
trans-unit.target: 这个包创建了一个框架，用于在多线程应用程序中跨线程按需复制解释器状态。它依赖于Tcl命令跟踪的机制以及Tcl 未知命令和机制。

trans-unit.source: This package creates and manages pools of worker threads . It allows you to post jobs to worker threads and wait for their completion . The threadpool implementation is Tcl event-loop aware . That means that any time a caller is forced to wait for an event (job being completed or a worker thread becoming idle or initialized), the implementation will enter the event loop and allow for servicing of other pending file or timer (or any other supported) events .
trans-unit.target: 这个包可以创建和管理工作线程池。它允许你把工作发布到工作线程中并等待它们的完成。这个线程池的实现是Tcl事件循环感知。这意味着任何时候,当一个调用者被迫等待一个事件(作业完成或一个工作线程变得空闲或初始化)时,该实现将进入事件循环,并允许服务于其他待定的文件或定时器(或任何其他支持的)事件。

trans-unit.source: This procedure creates and displays a message window with an application-specified message, an icon and a set of buttons. Each of the buttons in the message window is identified by a unique symbolic name (see the -type options). After the message window is popped up, tk_messageBox waits for the user to select one of the buttons. Then it returns the symbolic name of the selected button.

trans-unit.source: This read-only option gets the current checksum for the uncompressed data that the compression engine has seen so far. It is valid for both compressing and decompressing transforms, but not for the raw inflate and deflate formats. The compression algorithm depends on what format is being produced or consumed.

trans-unit.source: This read-write option is used by decompressing channels to control the maximum number of bytes ahead to read from the underlying data source. This defaults to 1, which ensures that data is always decompressed correctly, but may be increased to improve performance. This is more useful when the channel is non-blocking.

trans-unit.target: 这个读写选项获取或设置了在压缩或解压要压缩的数据时要使用的初始压缩字典。

trans-unit.source: This returns a boolean value indicating whether the given key (or path of keys through a set of nested dictionaries) exists in the given dictionary value. This returns a true value exactly when dict get on that path will succeed.

trans-unit.source: This returns a two-element list describing the method implementations used to implement the current call chain. The first element is the same as would be reported by info objectcall for the current method (except that this also reports useful values from within constructors and destructors, whose names are reported as <constructor> and <destructor> respectively), and the second element is an index into the first element's list that indicates which actual implementation is currently executing (the first implementation to execute is always at index 0).
trans-unit.target: 这将返回一个由两个元素组成的列表，描述用于实现当前调用链的方法实现。第一个元素与信息对象调用当前方法所报告的元素相同（除了它还会报告构造函数和析构函数中的有用值，其名称分别报告为<constructor>和<destructor>），第二个元素element是第一个元素列表的索引，指示当前正在执行哪个实际实现（要执行的第一个实现始终位于索引0）。

trans-unit.source: This returns information (intended for display to people) about the given dictionary though the format of this data is dependent on the implementation of the dictionary. For dictionaries that are implemented by hash tables, it is expected that this will return the string produced by Tcl_HashStats, similar to array statistics.
trans-unit.target: 尽管此数据的格式取决于字典的实现，但是这将返回有关给定字典的信息（旨在向人们显示）。对于由哈希表实现的字典，预期这将返回Tcl_HashStats生成的字符串，类似于数组统计信息。

trans-unit.target: 这个程序是由被称为:: msgcat :: MC的情况下，当翻译

trans-unit.source: This scheme provides a natural migration path for code development. Classes can be developed quickly using Tcl code to implement the bodies. An entire application can be built and tested. When necessary, individual bodies can be implemented with C code to improve performance.
trans-unit.target: 这个方案为代码开发提供了一个自然的迁移路径。可以使用Tcl代码快速开发类来实现体。可以构建和测试整个应用程序。在必要的时候,可以用C代码来实现单个机构,以提高性能。

trans-unit.source: This scheme provides a natural migration path for code development. Extendedclasses can be developed quickly using Tcl code to implement the bodies. An entire application can be built and tested. When necessary, individual bodies can be implemented with C code to improve performance.
trans-unit.target: 这个方案为代码开发提供了一个自然的迁移路径。可以使用Tcl代码快速开发扩展类来实现体。整个应用程序可以被构建和测试。在必要的时候,可以用C代码来实现各个机构,以提高性能。

trans-unit.source: This scheme provides a natural migration path for code development. Widgets can be developed quickly using Tcl code to implement the bodies. An entire application can be built and tested. When necessary, individual bodies can be implemented with C code to improve performance.
trans-unit.target: 这个方案为代码开发提供了一个自然的迁移路径。控件可以使用Tcl代码快速开发,实现主体。整个应用程序可以被构建和测试。在必要的时候,可以用C代码来实现单个机构,以提高性能。

trans-unit.target: 这个脚本片段可以用来制作一个在特定显示器上只运行一次的应用程序。

trans-unit.target: 这将在当前名称空间中搜索从Blt导入的所有命令。如果找到任何内容，则会将其删除。否则，它什么都不做。此后，必须使用Blt ::前缀访问Blt命令。

trans-unit.source: This second example shows how the callback gets passed the number of bytes transferred. It also uses vwait to put the application into the event loop. Of course, this simplified example could be done without the command callback.
trans-unit.target: 第二个例子展示了回调是如何获得传输的字节数的。它还使用vwait将应用程序放入事件循环。当然,这个简化的例子可以不使用命令回调。

trans-unit.source: This section describes commands for creating and destroying threads and sending scripts to threads for evaluation .
trans-unit.target: 本节介绍了创建和销毁线程以及向线程发送脚本进行评估的命令。

trans-unit.source: This section describes commands implementing thread shared variables . A thread shared variable is very similar to a Tcl array but in contrast to a Tcl array it is created in shared memory and can be accessed from many threads at the same time . Important feature of thread shared variable is that each access to the variable is internaly protected by a mutex so script programmer does not have to take care about locking the variable himself .
trans-unit.target: 本节介绍实现线程共享变量的命令。线程共享变量与Tcl数组非常相似,但与Tcl数组不同的是,它是在共享内存中创建的,并且可以从多个线程同时访问。线程共享变量的重要特点是,每次对变量的访问都是由内部的mutex保护的,所以脚本程序员不必担心自己锁定变量。

trans-unit.source: This section describes user-level commands . Those commands can be used by script writers to control the execution of the tracing framework .
trans-unit.target: 本节介绍用户级命令。这些命令可以被脚本编写者用来控制跟踪框架的执行。

trans-unit.target: 这显示了如何制作一个简单的通用命令,对列表中的每个元素进行转换。

trans-unit.source: This slot (see SLOTTED DEFINITIONS below) allows the alteration of the superclasses of the class being defined. Each
trans-unit.target: 该插槽（请参见下面的SLOTTED DEFINITIONS）允许更改所定义类的超类。每

trans-unit.source: This slot (see SLOTTED DEFINITIONS below) arranges for each of the named variables to be automatically made available in the methods declared by the object being defined. Each variable name must not have any namespace separators and must not look like an array access. All variables will be actually present in the object on which the method is executed. Note that the variable lists declared by the classes and mixins of which the object is an instance are completely disjoint; the list of variable names is just for methods declared by this object. By default, this slot works by appending.
trans-unit.target: 该插槽（请参见下面的SLOTTED DEFINITIONS）安排每个命名变量在要定义的对象声明的方法中自动可用。每个变量名称都不能有任何名称空间分隔符，并且不能看起来像数组访问。所有变量将实际存在于执行该方法的对象中。注意，由对象作为实例的类和混合实例声明的变量列表是完全不相交的；变量名列表仅用于此对象声明的方法。默认情况下，此插槽通过追加工作。

trans-unit.source: This slot (see SLOTTED DEFINITIONS below) arranges for each of the named variables to be automatically made available in the methods, constructor and destructor declared by the class being defined. Each variable name must not have any namespace separators and must not look like an array access. All variables will be actually present in the instance object on which the method is executed. Note that the variable lists declared by a superclass or subclass are completely disjoint, as are variable lists declared by instances; the list of variable names is just for methods (and constructors and destructors) declared by this class. By default, this slot works by appending.
trans-unit.target: 该插槽（请参见下面的SLOTTED DEFINITIONS）安排每个命名变量在要定义的类所声明的方法，构造函数和析构函数中自动可用。每个变量名称都不能有任何名称空间分隔符，并且不能看起来像数组访问。所有变量实际上将存在于执行该方法的实例对象中。请注意，由超类或子类声明的变量列表与实例声明的变量列表完全不相交。变量名列表仅用于此类所声明的方法（以及构造函数和析构函数）。默认情况下，此插槽通过追加工作。

trans-unit.source: This slot (see SLOTTED DEFINITIONS below) sets or updates a per-object list of additional classes that are to be mixed into the object. Each argument,

trans-unit.source: This specifies that the widget becomes active when the pointer enters the widget, and inactive when it leaves. Similarly it becomes pressed when the mouse button is pressed, and !pressed on the ButtonRelease event. In addition, the button unpresses if pointer is dragged outside the widget while Button-1 is held down, and represses if it's dragged back in. Finally, when the mouse button is released, the widget's -command is invoked, but only if the button is currently in the pressed state. (The actual bindings are a little more complicated than the above, but not by much).
trans-unit.target: 这指定当指针进入窗口小部件时窗口小部件变为活动状态，而当指针离开窗口小部件时变为无效状态。同样，当按下鼠标按钮并在ButtonRelease事件上！按下时，它也会变为按下状态。另外，如果在按住Button-1的同时将鼠标指针拖动到窗口小部件外部，则按钮将不显示；如果将鼠标指针向后拖动，则按钮将不显示。最后，释​​放鼠标按钮时，将调用窗口小部件的-command，但前提是按钮当前处于按下状态。 （实际的绑定比上面的要复杂一些，但要复杂得多）。

trans-unit.source: This variable contains a regular expression that is used by routines like tcl_endOfWord to identify whether a character is part of a word or not. If the pattern matches a character, the character is considered to be a non-word character. On Windows platforms, spaces, tabs, and newlines are considered non-word characters. Under Unix, everything but numbers, letters and underscores are considered non-word characters.
trans-unit.target: 此变量包含一个正则表达式，诸如tcl_endOfWord之类的例程使用该正则表达式来标识字符是否为单词的一部分。如果模式与字符匹配，则该字符被视为非单词字符。在Windows平台上，空格，制表符和换行符被视为非单词字符。在Unix下，数字，字母和下划线以外的所有内容均视为非单词字符。

trans-unit.source: This variable contains a regular expression that is used by routines like tcl_endOfWord to identify whether a character is part of a word or not. If the pattern matches a character, the character is considered to be a word character. On Windows platforms, words are comprised of any character that is not a space, tab, or newline. Under Unix, words are comprised of numbers, letters or underscores.
trans-unit.target: 此变量包含一个正则表达式，诸如tcl_endOfWord之类的例程使用该正则表达式来标识字符是否为单词的一部分。如果图案与字符匹配，则该字符被视为单词字符。在Windows平台上，单词由不是空格，制表符或换行符的任何字符组成。在Unix下，单词由数字，字母或下划线组成。

trans-unit.source: This variable controls the number of digits to generate when converting floating-point values to strings. It defaults to 0.
trans-unit.target: 这个变量控制将浮点值转换为字符串时要生成的数字数量。默认值为0。

trans-unit.source: This variable holds a list of directories indicating where packages are normally installed. It is not used on Windows. It typically contains either one or two entries; if it contains two entries, the first is normally a directory for platform-dependent packages (e.g., shared library binaries) and the second is normally a directory for platform-independent packages (e.g., script files). Typically a package is installed as a subdirectory of one of the entries in the tcl_pkgPath variable. The directories in the tcl_pkgPath variable are included by default in the auto_path variable, so they and their immediate subdirectories are automatically searched for packages during package require commands. Note: tcl_pkgPath is not intended to be modified by the application. Its value is added to auto_path at startup; changes to tcl_pkgPath are not reflected in auto_path. If you want Tcl to search additional directories for packages you should add the names of those directories to auto_path, not tcl_pkgPath.
trans-unit.target: 该变量包含目录列表，这些目录指示软件包的通常安装位置。 Windows上不使用它。它通常包含一个或两个条目。如果它包含两个条目，则第一个通常是与平台相关的软件包（例如，共享库二进制文件）的目录，第二个通常是与平台无关的软件包（例如，脚本文件）的目录。通常，将软件包安装为tcl_pkgPath变量中条目之一的子目录。默认情况下，tcl_pkgPath变量中的目录包含在auto_path变量中，因此在package require命令期间会自动搜索它们及其直接子目录中的软件包。注意：tcl_pkgPath不应由应用程序修改。它的值在启动时添加到auto_path；对tcl_pkgPath的更改不会反映在auto_path中。如果希望Tcl在其他目录中搜索软件包，则应将这些目录的名称添加到auto_path中，而不是tcl_pkgPath中。

trans-unit.source: This variable holds the file name for a directory containing a library of Tcl scripts related to Tk. These scripts include an initialization file that is normally processed whenever a Tk application starts up, plus other files containing procedures that implement default behaviors for widgets.
trans-unit.target: 这个变量是一个包含与Tk相关的Tcl脚本库的目录的文件名。这些脚本包括一个初始化文件,通常在Tk应用程序启动时进行处理,以及其他包含实现widget默认行为的程序的文件。

trans-unit.source: This variable holds the name of a directory containing the system library of Tcl scripts, such as those used for auto-loading. The value of this variable is returned by the info library command. See the library manual entry for details of the facilities provided by the Tcl script library. Normally each application or package will have its own application-specific script library in addition to the Tcl script library; each application should set a global variable with a name like $
trans-unit.target: 此变量保存包含Tcl脚本系统库的目录名称，例如用于自动加载的脚本。该变量的值由info library命令返回。有关Tcl脚本库提供的功能的详细信息，请参见库手册条目。通常，每个应用程序或程序包除Tcl脚本库外，还将具有自己的特定于应用程序的脚本库；每个应用程序应设置一个名称为$的全局变量

trans-unit.source: This variable holds the value of the -errorcode return option set by the most recent error that occurred in this interpreter. This list value represents additional information about the error in a form that is easy to process with programs. The first element of the list identifies a general class of errors, and determines the format of the rest of the list. The following formats for -errorcode return options are used by the Tcl core; individual applications may define additional formats.
trans-unit.target: 此变量保存此解释器中发生的最新错误所设置的-errorcode返回选项的值。此列表值以易于使用程序处理的形式表示有关错误的其他信息。列表的第一个元素标识错误的一般类别，并确定列表其余部分的格式。Tcl内核使用以下-errorcode返回选项格式：各个应用程序可以定义其他格式。

trans-unit.source: This variable holds the value of the -errorinfo return option set by the most recent error that occurred in this interpreter. This string value will contain one or more lines identifying the Tcl commands and procedures that were being executed when the most recent error occurred. Its contents take the form of a stack trace showing the various nested Tcl commands that had been invoked at the time of the error.
trans-unit.target: 此变量保存由该解释器中发生的最新错误设置的-errorinfo返回选项的值。该字符串值将包含一个或多个行，这些行标识出最近的错误发生时正在执行的Tcl命令和过程。它的内容采用堆栈跟踪的形式，显示了在错误发生时调用的各种嵌套Tcl命令。

trans-unit.source: This variable is an array containing several pieces of information that are private to Tk. The elements of tk::Priv are used by Tk library procedures and default bindings. They should not be accessed by any code outside Tk.
trans-unit.target: 此变量是一个数组，其中包含Tk专有的几条信息。Tk库过程和默认绑定使用tk :: Priv的元素。Tk之外的任何代码都不应访问它们。

trans-unit.source: This variable is maintained by Tcl as an array whose elements are the environment variables for the process. Reading an element will return the value of the corresponding environment variable. Setting an element of the array will modify the corresponding environment variable or create a new one if it does not already exist. Unsetting an element of env will remove the corresponding environment variable. Changes to the env array will affect the environment passed to children by commands like exec. If the entire env array is unset then Tcl will stop monitoring env accesses and will not update environment variables.
trans-unit.target: Tcl将该变量作为一个数组维护，其元素是该过程的环境变量。读取一个元素将返回相应环境变量的值。设置数组的元素将修改相应的环境变量，或者如果尚不存在则创建一个新的环境变量。取消设置env的元素将删除相应的环境变量。对env数组的更改将影响通过exec之类的命令传递给子级的环境。如果整个ENV阵列未设置则Tcl将停止监视ENV访问，并不会更新环境变量。

trans-unit.source: This variable is set to zero by default. If an application sets it to one, then Tk attempts to adhere as closely as possible to Motif look-and-feel standards. For example, active elements such as buttons and scrollbar sliders will not change color when the pointer passes over them. Modern applications should not normally set this variable.
trans-unit.target: 这个变量默认设置为0,如果应用程序将其设置为1,那么Tk就会尽量遵守Motif的外观标准。如果一个应用程序将其设置为1,那么Tk就会尽可能地遵守Motif的外观和感觉标准。例如,活动元素如按钮和滚动条滑块在指针经过它们时不会改变颜色。现代应用程序通常不应该设置这个变量。

trans-unit.source: This variable is used during initialization to indicate the name of a user-specific startup file. If it is set by application-specific initialization, then the Tcl startup code will check for the existence of this file and source it if it exists. For example, for wish the variable is set to ~/.wishrc for Unix and ~/wishrc.tcl for Windows.

trans-unit.source: Thread shared variables are inspired by the nsv interface found in AOLserver, a highly scalable Web server from America Online .

trans-unit.source: Thread shared variables are not bound to any thread explicitly . That means that when a thread which created any of thread shared variables exits, the variable and associated memory is not unset/reclaimed . User has to explicitly unset the variable to reclaim the memory consumed by the variable .
trans-unit.target: 线程共享变量不会被明确地绑定到任何线程上。这意味着,当创建任何线程共享变量的线程退出时,该变量和相关的内存不会被取消设置/回收。用户必须显式地取消设置该变量,以回收该变量消耗的内存。

trans-unit.source: ThreadCmd
trans-unit.target: ThreadCmd

trans-unit.source: Threadpool is one of the most common threading paradigm when it comes to server applications handling a large number of relatively small tasks . A very simplistic model for building a server application would be to create a new thread each time a request arrives and service the request in the new thread . One of the disadvantages of this approach is that the overhead of creating a new thread for each request is significant; a server that created a new thread for each request would spend more time and consume more system resources in creating and destroying threads than in processing actual user requests . In addition to the overhead of creating and destroying threads, active threads consume system resources . Creating too many threads can cause the system to run out of memory or trash due to excessive memory consumption .
trans-unit.target: 当涉及到服务器应用程序处理大量相对较小的任务时,Threadpool是最常见的线程范式之一。一个非常简单化的构建服务器应用程序的模型是在每次请求到达时创建一个新的线程,并在新的线程中服务请求。这种方法的一个缺点是,为每个请求创建一个新线程的开销是很大的;一个为每个请求创建一个新线程的服务器,在创建和销毁线程上花费的时间和消耗的系统资源会比处理实际的用户请求多。除了创建和销毁线程的开销外,活动线程也会消耗系统资源。创建过多的线程会导致系统内存耗尽或因内存消耗过多而产生垃圾 。

trans-unit.source: Threads created by the thread::create cannot be destroyed forcefully . Consequently, there is no corresponding thread destroy command . A thread may only be released using the thread::release and if its internal reference count drops to zero, the thread is marked for exit . This kicks the thread out of the event loop servicing and the thread continues to execute commands passed in the script argument, following the thread::wait command . If this was the last command in the script, as usualy the case, the thread will exit .
trans-unit.target: 由thread :: create创建的线程无法被强制销毁。因此，没有相应的线程破坏命令。只能使用thread :: release释放线程，并且如果其内部引用计数降至零，则将该线程标记为exit。这将线程踢出事件循环服务，并且线程继续执行thread :: wait命令之后在script参数中传递的命令。如果这是脚本中的最后一个命令（通常），则线程将退出。

trans-unit.source: Three annotations may be displayed in a scale widget: a label appearing at the top right of the widget (top left for horizontal scales), a number displayed just to the left of the slider (just above the slider for horizontal scales), and a collection of numerical tick marks just to the left of the current value (just below the trough for horizontal scales). Each of these three annotations may be enabled or disabled using the configuration options.
trans-unit.target: 可在刻度尺小组件中显示三种注释:小组件右上方显示的标签(水平刻度尺为左上方)、滑块左侧显示的数字(水平刻度尺为滑块上方)以及当前值左侧的数字刻度线集合(水平刻度尺为低谷下方)。这三种注释中的每一种都可以通过配置选项来启用或禁用。

trans-unit.source: Time in seconds an idle worker thread waits for the job to get posted to the job queue . If no job arrives during this interval and the time expires, the worker thread will check the number of currently available worker threads and if the number is higher than the number set by the minthreads option, it will exit . If an exitscript has been defined, the exiting worker thread will first run the script and then exit . Errors from the exit script, if any, are ignored .
trans-unit.target: 空闲的工作线程等待该作业发布到作业队列中的时间（以秒为单位）。如果在此时间间隔内没有作业到达并且时间到期，则工作线程将检查当前可用的工作线程的数量，并且如果该数量大于minthreads选项设置的数量，它将退出。如果exitscript已经被定义，退出工作线程将首先运行该脚本，然后退出。退出脚本中的错误（如果有）将被忽略。

trans-unit.source: To execute the unknown handler, the ensemble mechanism takes the specified -unknown option and appends each argument of the attempted ensemble command invocation (including the ensemble command itself, expressed as a fully qualified name). It invokes the resulting command in the scope of the attempted call. If the execution of the unknown handler terminates normally, the ensemble engine reparses the subcommand (as described below) and tries to dispatch it again, which is ideal for when the ensemble's configuration has been updated by the unknown subcommand handler. Any other kind of termination of the unknown handler is treated as an error.
trans-unit.target: 为了执行未知的处理程序，ensemble机制采用指定的-unknown选项，并附加尝试的ensemble命令调用的每个参数（包括ensemble命令本身，表示为完全限定的名称）。它在尝试调用的范围内调用结果命令。如果未知处理程序的执行正常终止，则集成引擎将重新解析该子命令（如下所述），然后尝试再次调度它，这对于由未知子命令处理程序更新了集成的配置是理想的。未知处理程序的任何其他类型的终止都被视为错误。

trans-unit.source: To further prevent potential information leakage from sensitive files that are accidentally included in the set of files that can be sourced by a safe interpreter, the source alias restricts access to files meeting the following constraints: the file name must fourteen characters or shorter, must not contain more than one dot (“.”), must end up with the extension (“.tcl”) or be called (“tclIndex”.)
trans-unit.target: 为了进一步防止可能由安全解释器提供的文件集中意外包含的敏感文件泄漏潜在的信息，源别名将限制对满足以下约束的文件的访问：文件名必须为14个字符或更短，不得包含多个点（“ ”），必须具有扩展名（“最终.tcl ”）或称为（“ tclIndex的 ”）。

To use a literal - as the first endpoint of a range, make it a collating element or (AREs only) precede it with “\”. With the exception of these, some combinations using [ (see next paragraphs), and escapes, all other special characters lose their special significance within a bracket expression.

trans-unit.source: To pass, a test must successfully evaluate its -setup, -body, and -cleanup scripts. The return code of the -body script and its result must match expected values, and if specified, output and error data from the test must match expected -output and -errorOutput values. If any of these conditions are not met, then the test fails. Note that all scripts are evaluated in the context of the caller of test.
